# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pygments/styles/_mapping.py
@source-hash: f2763d6dc105d59c
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:58Z

## Primary Purpose
Auto-generated mapping file that provides a registry of all available Pygments syntax highlighting styles. Serves as a central lookup table for style discovery and dynamic loading within the Pygments library.

## Key Components

**STYLES Dictionary (L4-53)**
- Central registry mapping style class names to their module metadata
- Each entry: `'StyleClassName': ('module.path', 'style_alias', ())`
- Tuple format: (import_path, style_identifier, additional_metadata)
- Contains 49 predefined styles covering various themes and color schemes

## Architecture & Patterns

**Auto-Generation Pattern**
- Generated by `scripts/gen_mapfiles.py` (L1)
- Manual editing explicitly discouraged (L2) 
- Regenerated via `tox -e mapfiles` command
- Ensures consistency between actual style implementations and registry

**Style Organization**
- Covers diverse themes: dark/light variants, language-specific styles, editor themes
- Notable variants: Gruvbox (dark/light), Solarized (dark/light), Paraiso (dark/light)
- Mix of classic terminal themes (vim, emacs) and modern editor themes (dracula, material, one-dark)

## Dependencies & Relationships
- All styles reference `pygments.styles.*` modules
- Style classes follow naming convention: `[Name]Style`
- Used by Pygments' style loading mechanism for dynamic imports
- Third tuple element (empty tuples) reserved for future metadata extension

## Critical Constraints
- File must remain synchronized with actual style implementations
- Style class names must match actual class definitions in referenced modules  
- Module paths must be valid Python import paths
- Auto-generation dependency prevents manual customization
